mainText.attr1: Ships in formations inherit certain things from their leader.
When a ship joins a formation it inherits the posture
Example: leader is set to Do Not Engage - new ship joins formation and now is set to Do Not Engage.
When a ship joins a formation it inherits the weapons hold setting
Example: leader is set to weapons hold - new ship joins formation and now is set to weapons hold.
The follower inherits the leader's commands.
When a leader ship is destroyed, another ship is elected leader, this ship inherits the former leader's orders.
Deciding that ships should inherit postures and weapons hold settings is tricky. Overall I chose the inheritance route to make things simpler in terms of micro managing.

For example - a formation leader is set to do not engage, a new ship enters the sector via a gate and forms up with the leader (rally point setting). If not for inheritance the new ship might engage the enemy instead of taking the defensive posture of lead ship. Without inheritance the player would have to select the new ship and then set the proper setting.
